dmca.title: [ABUSE] *** Notice of Possible Security Compromise [Notice ID: 1615715]

Sent: Wednesday, September 22, 2004 5:08 PM
To: Legal Response
Cc: security@theplanet.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] *** Notice of Possible Security Compromise [Notice
ID: 1615715]]

Forwarding to Legal and Security for review.


-------- Original Message --------

16:23:44 -0500

lili.theplanet.com with SMTP; 22 Sep 2004 21:23:44 -0000

1CAEaU-0005At-0U        for abuse@theplanet.com; Wed, 22 Sep 2004 16:23:42
-0500

14:23:53 -0700

(5.5.2653.19) id <S62A955P>; Wed, 22 Sep 2004 14:24:32 -0700

usush2kex21.udh.unistudios.com with SMTP (Microsoft Exchange        Internet
Mail Service Version 5.5.2653.13)        id TG2YXST6; Wed, 22 Sep 2004
14:21:48
-0700
From: antipiracy@nbcuni.com
To: abuse@theplanet.com
Date: Wed, 22 Sep 2004 14:15:47 -0700
Message-ID: <USUSH2KEX53ZStgLzhV00000974@usush2kex53>
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 22 Sep 2004 21:23:53.0765 (UTC)
FILETIME=[761D7550:01C4A0EA]
Received-SPF: none (mail.theplanet.com: 66.77.89.164 is neither
permitted nor        denied by domain of nbcuni.com) client-ip=66.77.89.164;
envelope-from=antipiracy@nbcuni.com; helo=mail.nbcuni.com;
Cc:
Subject: [ABUSE] *** Notice of Possible Security Compromise [Notice ID:
1615715]
X-BeenThere: abuse@lists.theplanet.com
X-Mailman-Version: 2.1.5
Precedence: list
Reply-To: antipiracy@nbcuni.com
List-Id: abuse.lists.theplanet.com
List-Unsubscribe: <http://lists.theplanet.com/mailman/listinfo/abuse>,
<mailto:abuse-request@lists.theplanet.com?subject=unsubscribe>
List-Archive: <http://lists.theplanet.com/mailman/private/abuse>
List-Post: <mailto:abuse@lists.theplanet.com>
List-Help: <mailto:abuse-request@lists.theplanet.com?subject=help>
List-Subscribe: <http://lists.theplanet.com/mailman/listinfo/abuse>,
<mailto:abuse-request@lists.theplanet.com?subject=subscribe>
Sender: abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com
Errors-To: abuse-bounces@lists.theplanet.com

Re:  Possible Security Compromise and Unauthorized Use of Universal
Motion Pictures
Notice ID: 1615715
20 Sep 2004 22:33:22 GMT

It has come to our attention that a computer, for which you are
registered as its service provider, appears to be running an XDCC server
or similar IRC bot software to distribute unauthorized copies of
Universal's Motion Pictures.  It is well documented that most of these
XDCC servers are running on computers that have been hacked, so it is
very possible that the machine located at the IP referenced below has
likewise been compromised.  There are many resources online that
describe this issue as well as provide solutions to stop this type of
activity.

When you have disabled the rogue software on the machine and removed the
pirate files, please reply to this email to let us know the issue has
been resolved.

Please be advised that this letter is not intended as a complete
statement of the facts or law as they pertain to this matter, and that
Universal reserves all rights and remedies.

Very truly yours,

/s/

Aaron Markham
Manager of Internet Anti-Piracy,
Worldwide Anti-Piracy Operations
VIVENDI UNIVERSAL ENTERTAINMENT.
100 Universal City Plaza
Universal City, CA  91608
tel.  (818) 777-3111
fax  (818) 866-6339
antipiracy@unistudios.com

*pgp public key is available on the key server at ldap://keyserver.pgp.com
Notice ID: 1615715
